intro: Scorzonera angustifolia var. minor, commonly known as the narrowleaf scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in a loose, branched inflorescence. It is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
